<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

Nodes in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/anonymous-namespace-amdgpusplitmodule-cpp-/splitgraph">SplitGraph</a> contain both incoming, and outgoing edges.

<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/incoming">Incoming</a> edges have this node as their Dst, and Outgoing ones have this node as their Src.

<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/anonymous-namespace-amdgpusplitmodule-cpp-/splitgraph/edge">Edge</a> objects are shared by both nodes in Src/Dst. They provide immediate feedback on how two nodes are related, and in which direction they are related, which is valuable information to make splitting decisions.

Nodes are fundamentally abstract, and any consumers of the graph should treat them as such. While a node will be a function most of the time, we could also create nodes for any other reason. In the future, we could have single nodes for multiple functions, or nodes for GVs, etc.

Definition at line 372 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpusplitmodule-cpp">AMDGPUSplitModule.cpp</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### getDependencies() {#a853692dee5306a0d1c6ddafc53e954dd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AMDGPUSplitModule.cpp&#125;::SplitGraph::Node::getDependencies (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitvector">BitVector</a> &amp; BV) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Adds the depedencies of this node in <code>BV</code> by setting the bit corresponding to each node.

Implemented using <a href="#ade1d9ae1e23cd1cf3fdd6bea6a1ff1e6">visitAllDependencies</a>, hence it follows the same rules regarding dependencies traversal.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="[out] BV">The bitvector where the bits should be set.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

### getID() {#ad9ad3c04d7fd48185f562d4f0a102873}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned llvm::anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AMDGPUSplitModule.cpp&#125;::SplitGraph::Node::getID () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
An 0-indexed ID for the node.

The maximum ID (exclusive) is the number of nodes in the graph. This ID can be used as an index in a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitvector">BitVector</a>.

### isGraphEntryPoint() {#a07453d65be0f4ac15b1588c28fe9cc2c}

  labels = {["inline"]}>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
whether this is an entry point in the graph. Entry points are defined as follows: if you take all entry points in the graph, and iterate their dependencies, you are guaranteed to visit all nodes in the graph at least once.
</SectionUser>

### visitAllDependencies() {#ade1d9ae1e23cd1cf3fdd6bea6a1ff1e6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AMDGPUSplitModule.cpp&#125;::SplitGraph::Node::visitAllDependencies (std::function&lt; void(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/anonymous-namespace-amdgpusplitmodule-cpp-/splitgraph/node">Node</a> &amp;)&gt; Visitor) const</>}>
Visit all children of this node in a recursive fashion.

Also visits Self. If <a href="#a4e237599c581d78bde8e3c8512f95652">shouldFollowIndirectCalls</a> returns false, then this only follows DirectCall edges.
